comment: One of the best professors at KSU. I took control theory with him and got an A. it's a hard course but he will make sure you understand but have to ask him questions. he is a fair grader and give you a curve if you tell him are showing work. Overall solid professor, he always replied to my emails within 1 hour.

Professor Ruhala is an overall great professor, he may not be the most exciting, but is straight to the point. All information that is needed for tests/quizzes comes from his notes and homework. Having said that, his class is not an easy A, you still have to put in the time in order to earn it.

Took Dr. Ruhala for Vibrations and Controls Lab online. Pretty straightforward class, just follow the instructions he gives during lecture and turn stuff in on time. Should've been an easy A but I had some late work. Nice guy, would recommend (but not over Tekes or Sarmast).

I had Dr. Rich for Acoustics and he was pretty solid. The course material was very interesting and he's pretty good at explaining everything. The homework and tests were a little challenging but he's a pretty fair grader (he curves too). He did take kind of long to grade things. Project instead of final exam. Would definitely take again.
Although, the course material is easy. Mr. Ruhala lectures is very difficult to comprehend because he doesnt have a full understanding of Matlab. He also isnt professional. I wouldnt take him.

Dr. Ruhala was new to teaching MATLAB but he was okay at it. Was basically the go-between for what the text said and what you had to do. Pretty easy to do well in the class just show up and pay attention. Tests are open book and open MATLAB help so not that hard to just look for something you forgot.

Has solid knowledge of subject matter. Very fair with grading and gives ample opportunity for students to do well. Slightly quirky personality/ teaching style but easily one of the nicest and approachable professors in the department.

Not so much easy as very straight forward. Dr. Ruhala is very concerned about his students' progress and making sure they understand the material. To this end he's very helpful and always willing to pause whatever he is currently working on for a few minutes to help out a question or problem. Take him if you get the opportunity.

I took three classes with him. He is very concerned about the studentâ€™s progress. Some lecture notes ar posted online with blanks and you should print them and bring them to class.  If you are willing to put effort, I recommend him.

Not too hard. However, not worth taking. Wife is constantly interrupting. He is always under-prepaired. Didn't take our first test until 3/4 of the way through the semester. This test covered stuff from the beginning and then tests in rapid fire. I still have no idea where I stand because He never gave us any of my test grades back.
Goes through notes very slowly. Keeping attentive is hard at the rate of teaching. His wife needs to leave his class alone, if you take him you will see what I mean.
